content: <div>
Manning the Arm
<div>
On my first trip to the International Space Station, it was my job to use the robotic arm to install
a laboratory onto the station.
<div>
The robotic arm is attached to the exterior of the International Space Station
and astronauts use it to bring stuff from the space shuttle onto the station.
It has joints that can move like a human arm, but it’s way stronger.
I went through a ton of training to learn how to use the robotic arm!
<div>
There are two controllers used
to operate it. One looks like a joystick. It’s called a rotational hand controller.

The other is called a translational hand controller. It’s kind of like a video game where you have to use both hands to move very valuable and delicate things around, like the Columbus Lab, or other astronauts.
But before we went up on our mission, I was in contact with the German scientists who had been planning
this event for a long time. They would be communicating with us from ground control while we installed the lab.
<div class='img-panel'>
After a meeting, one of the men came up to me and said:
I had been building the skills to do this job my entire life.
<div class='img-panel img-panel-captioned'>
I wasn’t about to screw it up!
<div>
When we got up there, everything was moving along smoothly. Using the robotic arm I had no trouble unloading the
23,000 pound lab from the Atlantis Shuttle. I was in total control.
But when the lab was almost in place, the arm stopped moving. It seemed like something had jammed…
<div>
I tried to remain calm. I had trained and trained and traveled into space just for this moment.
I knew what I had to do.
<div>
As I slowly readjusted the controls, everything began moving again and the pieces finally came together correctly.
<div>
My experience has been used for Robotic Arm training at NASA. Other astronauts ask me about my technique and I tell them
what my dad always told me - “practice makes perfect.”
The years I spent practicing in the simulator while I was grounded developed the intuitive knowledge I needed to make a
good decision under pressure.
<div class='shadow-box text-left'>
Because I wholeheartedly pursued things that I love, I was able to find my path to space, and to manning the
robotic arm. Once I was on that path, everything was pushing me forward to this moment where I was able to put
my skills to good use.
Even though it can often feel like life just does what it wants with you, if you work hard and follow your
passion, sometimes you get to do some extraordinary things!
